title: React Hooks Cheat Sheet
content:
useState: const [state, setState] = useState(initialValue)
useEffect: useEffect(() => { effect }, [dependencies])
useContext: const value = useContext(MyContext)
useRef: const ref = useRef(initialValue)
useCallback: const memoizedCallback = useCallback(() => { doSomething(a, b) }, [a, b])

title: Git Commands Reference
content:
git init - Initialize repository
git add . - Stage all files
git commit -m "message" - Commit changes
git push origin main - Push to remote
git pull origin main - Pull from remote
git branch feature-name - Create branch
git checkout feature-name - Switch branch
git merge feature-name - Merge branch

title: JavaScript Interview Questions
content:
1. What is closure?
2. Explain event bubbling and capturing
3. Difference between var, let, and const
4. What is hoisting?
5. Explain promises and async/await
6. What is the event loop?
7. Difference between == and ===
8. Explain prototypal inheritance

title: Recipe: Chicken Stir Fry
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, sliced
- 2 cups mixed vegetables
- 3 tbsp soy sauce
- 2 tbsp oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 inch ginger, grated

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in wok
2. Cook chicken until golden
3. Add vegetables and stir fry
4. Add soy sauce and seasonings
5. Serve over rice

title: Productivity Tips
content:
1. Use the Pomodoro Technique (25 min work, 5 min break)
2. Create a daily priority list
3. Eliminate distractions (phone on silent)
4. Take regular breaks
5. Use time blocking
6. Review and reflect daily
7. Set SMART goals
8. Practice the 2-minute rule

title: Node.js Best Practices
content:
1. Use async/await instead of callbacks
2. Implement proper error handling
3. Use environment variables for configuration
4. Implement logging with Winston or Bunyan
5. Use helmet for security headers
6. Validate input with Joi or Yup
7. Use PM2 for process management
8. Implement rate limiting

title: Morning Routine Checklist
content:
1. Wake up at 6:00 AM
2. Drink a glass of water
3. Do 10 minutes of stretching
4. Take a cold shower
5. Eat a healthy breakfast
6. Review daily goals
7. Check calendar and emails
8. Start work by 7:30 AM

title: API Design Principles
content:
1. Use RESTful conventions
2. Implement proper HTTP status codes
3. Use consistent naming conventions
4. Include pagination for large datasets
5. Implement proper error responses
6. Use versioning (v1, v2)
7. Include rate limiting
8. Provide comprehensive documentation
